intro: Gynoxys jaramilloi, commonly known as the Jaramillo's gynoxys, is a species of flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom during the wet season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocky slopes or in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
